articles.title: Hear Cheney's question to GOP about Trump during her closing statement - CNN Video
articles.description: Former Obama adviser David Axelrod asks conservative commentator Scott Jennings, who voted for Trump twice, if he'd do so again after all of the evidence presented by the Jan. 6 select committee.

articles.author: Chris Isidore, CNN Business
articles.title: Volkswagen CEO to leave in surprise move
articles.description: Volkswagen's CEO is leaving his post in a surprise move, effective September 1.

articles.author: Veronica Stracqualursi, CNN
articles.title: Newsom signs California gun bill modeled after Texas abortion law
articles.description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom on Friday signed a bill into law that allows private citizens to bring civil action against anyone who manufactures, distributes, transports or imports assault weapons or ghost guns, which are banned in the state.

articles.author: Tierney Sneed, Katelyn Polantz and Holmes Lybrand, CNN
articles.title: Steve Bannon found guilty of contempt for defying January 6 committee subpoena
articles.description: A federal jury has found former Trump adviser Steve Bannon guilty of contempt of Congress for defying a subpoena from the House select committee investigating the January 6 attack.

articles.author: Whitney Wild and Jeremy Herb, CNN
articles.title: Secret Service identified potential missing text messages on phones of 10 individuals
articles.description: Secret Service investigators were scrutinizing the phones of 10 Secret Service personnel that contained metadata showing text messages were sent and received around January 6, 2021, but were not retained, two sources told CNN.

articles.author: Analysis by Chris Cillizza, CNN Editor-at-large
articles.title: Analysis: How the January 6 committee used Fox News against Donald Trump
articles.description: Everyone knows that Donald Trump is a devotee of Fox News. During his presidency, he would regularly live tweet his favorite shows and viewed primetime hosts like Sean Hannity as de facto advisers to his White House.

articles.author: Rebekah Riess and Tina Burnside, CNN
articles.title: Bo Jackson covered all funeral expenses for Uvalde victims' families, governor says
articles.description: Former sports star Bo Jackson covered all funeral expenses for the families of the victims of the Uvalde school massacre "so they would have one less thing to worry about as they grieved," according to a statement from Texas Gov. Greg Abbott.

articles.author: Opinion by Frida Ghitis
articles.title: Opinion: Why Trump didn't want to lift a finger on January 6
articles.description: Frida Ghitis writes the January 6 hearings proved that former President Donald Trump went far beyond dereliction of duty as the insurrection unfolded. He was an active, if indirect, participant in the effort to stop the certification of Joe Biden's victory.
